Course Description: THIS COURSE IS INTENDED FOR STUDENTS DESIRING A WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING USING SOFTWARE COMMONLY USED IN BUSINESS. THE COURSE COVERS THE FIVE MAJOR SYSTEMS COMMONLY FOUND IN COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING ENVIRONMENT; GENERAL LEDGER, INVENTORY, ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, ACCOUNTS PAYABLE, AND PAYROLL.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1.	RECORD BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS FOR A SERVICE COMPANY
2.	COMPLETE THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE FOR A SERVICE COMPANY
3.	RECORD BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS FOR A MERCHANDISING COMPANY
4.	COMPLETE THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE FOR A MERCHANDISING COMPANY
5.	IMPROVE RESEARCH, PROBLEM SOLVING AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS
6.	PERFORM BASIC FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
7.	DISCUSS PRINCIPLES OF ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
